bug.short_desc: qooxdoo doesn't work in Konqueror (KDE web browser)

long_desc.thetext:
I get this error in konqueror javascript log:
Error: file:///home/tenchi/projects/adv4seller/interface/adv4seller/build/script/adv4seller.js: TypeError: Attempt to use a non-function object or a value as a function
I can see just a blank screen.
I'm using Kubuntu Linux 10.04, KDE and Konqueror v4.4.2 but I've tested in other versions with the same results.

Hi, Konqueror is currently not on out list of supported browsers [1]. As far as we don't change that, it's good to know but we won't do anything about it, sorry. Regards, Martin
[1] http://qooxdoo.org/documentation/1.1/requirements#client

Hi, But is this a konqueror problem or a qooxdoo problem? KHTML is a good engine and support more web standards than IE6.
Regards

Hi, I guess its the combination of both, browser and qooxdoo. But as you sure know, konqueror is not one of the most famous browsers in the world [1]. Seems like it's not even having enough user to be listed in the statistics. Maybe it's a good browser and sure has some benefits over IE6 for example, but currently we are not willing to spend time on browsers not having enough market share. Sorry, Martin
[1]Â http://www.w3schools.com/browsers/browsers_stats.asp
